---
title: KPMG
author: ''
date: '2022-08-30'
slug: kpmg
categories: []
tags: []
r_init: |-
  
description: The Government of Canada spent an estimated $33.7M
  in 2021-2022 on contracts with KPMG. The average
  contract duration was 1.1 year, and the average contract
  value (not including contracts under $10k) was $703.8K.
  The longest contract was 9.92 year. The largest contract
  by value (including amendments) was $30.6M.
most_recent_fiscal_year_total: '33.7M'
most_recent_fiscal_year_year: '2021-2022'
s431_number_of_contracts_by_vendor: '282'
s431_number_of_contracts_by_vendor_with_amendments: '70'
s431_number_of_contracts_amendments_percentage: '25%'
s432_mean_amendment_increase_percentage_by_vendor: '159%'
s434_mean_number_of_amendments_by_vendor: '1.84'
s433_total_amendment_increase_value_by_vendor: '67.3M'
s424_mean_duration_by_vendor: '1.1'
s421_mean_contract_value_by_vendor: '703.8K'
s425_max_duration_by_vendor: '9.92'
s422_max_contract_value_by_vendor: '30.6M'
---
